div.bibl: Illinois Staats Zeitung, Feb. 7, 1887. F. W. KURTZ

body.p: The deceased was a distinguished member of the Masons, a comrade of the veterans of the United States Grant Post and an active member of several German societies. He was born in the Grand-duchy of Hessen, May 16, 1841, and came to America in 1852, settling in Connecticut where he attended the public schools.

At the outbreak of war he joined the 14th Connecticut Infantry Regiment, which was then assigned to the Potomac army. He took an active part throughout the campaign, fighting in several battles. After his release from the army in 1865, he came West, and married Mary P. Taylor of Hartford, Wisconsin, choosing Chicago as his future home, where he founded an iron foundry.
